title: Mycoplasma

source.description:
Items to bring to nanodrop machine
a. p2 pipette, p2 tips, pen, kimwipes, ice bucket
b. Keep samples on ice
Open the NanoDrop 1000 software and select nucleic acid from the main menu
Clean the nanodrop pedestal with a kimwipe

Add 2 µl
of nuclease free water to the center of the pedestal and gently close the lever arm
Click ‘OK’ to initialize the spectrophotometer
Select DNA from the dropdown menu

Clean the nanodrop pedestal with a kimwipe, add 2 µl
of a blank sample, and click ‘Blank’
a. Use quick extract solution as blank

Clean the nanodrop pedestal with a kimwipe, add 2 ul
of sample and click ‘Measure’
Record the concentration (ng/ul) of the sample on the tube and a table
Record the 260/280 ratio, and the 260/230 ratio

source.body:
260/280 ratio should be above 1.8 (salt contamination)
260/230 ratio should be 1-2

source.description: Clean the nanodrop pedestal with a kimwipe in-between samples
Click exit
Leave kimwipe between the pedestal and the lever arm when finished
Culture should be in at least 3-6 days of subculture after split
During isolation and PCR, use clean gloves, spray down bench, and keep reagents and tubes cold
Isolate cells once confluent, at least 3-6 days after split

After trypsinization for freezing cells, rinse remaining cells in both flasks with 12 mls
PBS

Spin for 5 mins
at 100 rpm
at 4C

Place in ice bucket
on bench or store in -80C

Add 40 µl
of Quick Extract to pellet

Pipette up and down and transfer to PCR tubes
a. Label PCR tube with line, date, and P for pellet

Extract gDNA with thermocycler program
a. Turn on Power button on the back of machine
b. Open lid with handle
c. Put PCR tubes in small slot and close lid
d. Select File, click Enter, select pcr chamber and start program
i. 65C
for 15 mins
ii. 98C
for 10 mins
iii. 4C
to hold
e. Run time around ~30mins
f. Click enter to exit after run
g. Turn off machine and place on ice

Centrifuge PCR tubes for 5 mins
at max
and transfer SN to new 1.5 mls tubes labeled gDNA, line, and date
a. Tiny pellet ok left in PCR tube
Nanodrop to determine gDNA (pre-PCR) concentration on ice

Store at -20C
or run PCR

Make a 20 µl
of PCR reaction in provided eMyco Plasma PCR Tube
a. QS to 20 µl
with nuclease free water
b. Add 40 ng
of sample
i. Can make working stock if concentration is too high
c. Include a negative control with just water (20 µl)
d. Include a positive control with provided positive control (1 µl)

source.name: e-Myco PLUS Mycoplasma PCR Detection Kit

source.description:
Run PCR program
a. Turn on machine at the back
b. Tap to mix, place samples into thermocycler in small tube holes, and close lid
c. Run myco program
Initial Denature = 94C
for 1 min
ii. 35 Cycles
Denature = 94C
for 30 secs
Anneal = 58C
5 for 20 secs
Extend = 72C
for 1 min
Final Extension = 72C
for 5 mins
Hold at 4C
d. Press enter to run program
g. Run time is around ~1.5hrs
Can prep for agarose gel near the end of the PCR run
Store gDNA samples, at -20C
After run, select enter, turn off machine, and place PCR product on ice
Run gel or store at -20C
Wet rubber around gel chamber to help it slide into gel rig
Assemble with rubber on the black edges of the gel rig and place purple comb in the slot on the right

Make 2% Agarose in small beaker with screw cap for a mini rig size.
a.1.2 g
of agarose with 60 mls
of 1X TAE (Stock is 20X TAE)

Microwave for 2 mins
with a loose cap and swirl every 30 seconds
until dissolved

When temperature is cool to the touch, add 1:10,000 of Etbr
ie add 6 µl
Etbr per 60 mls
of agarose

source.body: Mutagen - may potentially cause carcinogenic or teratogenic effects

source.description:
Swirl to mix and add to chamber to set, allow for 10 mins
to cool in cold room

Prep samples for gel in PCR tubes on ice
a. 5 µl
of PCR product
b. 3 µl
of Nuclease free water
c. 2.6 µl
of 6X loading buffer (2X final concentration from a 6X stock, purple)
i.(6X)(a) = (2X)(8ul); a = 2.6ul
Rotate gel chamber when set, so the lanes are at the top of the chamber
Fill with 1X TAE until the top of the white knob in gel rig and remove comb slowly

Load 4 µl
of 1kb O’gene plus ladder into first lane

source.name: GeneRuler 1 kb Plus DNA Ladder, ready-to-use

source.description:
Load 11 µl
of each sample per well
Add lid, black at the top, red at the bottom, both at the right side
Run at 130V for 50 mins
Store PCR product at -20C
Dispose Etbr waste in proper container (liquid and solid)
Aspirate supernate

description:
Detection of mycoplasma utilizing the bulldog-bio kit. Steps include, gDNA isolation from cells, nanodrop, PCR, and running an agarose gel to detect mycoplasma within a cell culture line.
Image from https://cellculturedish.com/cell-culture-basics-mycoplasma-101-a-practical-guide-to-prevention-detection-and-elimination-of-mycoplasma-contamination/
